M9qFZGUB4Q_jNvkFzZUuMw.text: Love love love Fazios as our neighborhood pizza place! Be ready to know what you want and order straightforward, they're not rude just the type of ship they run. Great lunch special of two slices and a drink $5! I have had wedges, salad, wings, hoagie and pizza and continue to order these over and over. It's a lil greasy but that's what makes it good! Right??

nYkg7afiGI1RsutovF4WtA.text: In my opinion, the best hand tossed thin crust pizza in Pittsburgh.  The wings are awesome if you like them crispy and sauce on the side like I do.  Hoagies are awesome too.  Everyone working is always friendly when myself and coworkers stop by for lunch.  They also have a nice little patio area in the back that's quiet and almost makes me forget I'm in the city.

oGs_Gx_sGznGS7C1O8Epyw.text: Exactly what I was looking for!  We got a medium and it was more than enough for 4 + leftovers.  Really good crust, sauce, toppings (cappicola).   There area ton of pizza places around here, but I'm not sure I will bother trying any others!

2vSs8d7JD5RLcUPKQJbAhA.text: I've gotten pizza from here twice and it's been consistently good. The crust is thinner than your typical Pittsburgh pizza and it's a little chewy. Since I'm a fan of thin-crust, I thought it was great! The sauce is a little tangy, a little sweet and not at all chunky. My favorite thing about this pizza was definitely the cheese...I loved the flavor and the consistency.   This is my new go-to pizza place! It's convenient (they deliver) and it is also reasonably priced.

hKjwipe-p0z0a6aWX8XoVQ.text: Fazio's has a secret: their Sicilian squares are pretty decent--one of the closest squares I could find comparable to Brooklyn square, which is hard to find in the east end. their normal pie is ok but the Sicilian is leagues better. 2 cuts will only set you back about $5, a great deal.

8heE_GRHvNQMWQHvjBjeRw.text: Good white pizza and its nice to have an option for sicilian. Good lunch specials, just wish they would offer white slices. Definitely above average pizza shop.

oSf59Uddu4JrlZm0TTdzbg.text: If you want greasy, cheesy pepperoni pizza, this is THE place in Bloomfield, in my opinion. It is that gooey, pepperoni-y, mouthwateringly delicious kind of pizza. If you want a good salad, this is not your place. But for classic, greasy pizza -- Fazio's is as good as it gets!

isjunDb40Jq2vSOEHsDjGQ.text: I would say that Fazio's is probably a small step ahead of Pesaro's. The pizza is a smidge crispier though delivery always results in a less crispy pizza than when you eat-in. I also like the steak hoagies. Service is quick and prompt and the food arrives piping hot. As others have noted - totally solid neighborhood pizza joint.

upDDHh6nsu3kYofRVzjHBA.text: Ha, I was just going to write "totally solid neighborhood pizza joint" which I see someone below has written. It is! Just walked in for the first time and got a slice of red sauce/pepperoni and white sauce/tomato, both tasty. They'd heated them up so the crust was crunchy.  Cheese blend on the white pizza was great. Reasonably priced, too.    A few tables to eat in, slices to go, also orders/delivery.  While I was there, I heard someone placing an intricate phone order (like the way Sally from When Harry Met Sally... ordered food) with items like "well done fries," and they seemed quite accommodating.  I will be back, especially if this winter is as bad as the last one.

vVCEmSoANN65wEnH8VoBTw.text: Really solid neighborhood pizza. Definitely the best delivery pizza I've had in pittsburgh. More east coast style than pittsburgh style, which is a-ok in my book, not having had the pleasure of being weaned on aiellos.  Thinner crust w/ some chew & char and not too much provolone in the cheese. And not too much cheese for that matter (I'm lookin at you minellos.)

-3FvpNyHtaKv3bp5HGfqBw.text: First trip was wonderful. Wedgie was wet but that's just what I wanted. Wife's hoggie was a big hit with her and the kid. Will be going back.

l8HYVC7GBbjbe-x-ZU4K3g.text: I just moved very close to Fazio's so I was hoping it would be a place I could rely upon for a good meal. It is! Very good Italian hoagies loaded with fixings, and good pizza. I haven't tried the steak sandwiches yet, but if the Italian hoagies are any indication, I bet I'll approve. The pizza crust is thin and crispy, and they used just the right amount of everything.

vYlsGrPp7hROQGh8okFt1w.text: I've eaten pizza, hoagies, and calzones here and they've all been solid (especially like the chicken parm sub).  Standard italian fare, but their good deals and prices make it one of my go to places when I'm too tired/lazy to cook.  For anyone who lives on this side of Bloomfield its convenience makes it at least worth trying.

uDa__gIw4TT3HK1hkj-Tjw.text: When this place first opened it was MUCH better. Over the past couple of years though, the quality and freshness have been replaced by grease. Nothing special at all, and the older guys have been over heard making remarks about their customers to each other. Not a winning strategy with so many other pizza joints around this 'hood.

KrFkymNGlA8S6tF28Wo5JA.text: Best pizza in my neighborhood. I could eat here every day. Yum.

rrUjMyBooNQN-5cqI1AchQ.text: I tried Fazio's for the first time. We live 5 minutes away, so I was hoping that the pizza would be hot when it arrived. Instead, it was barely warm. I had chicken, mushrooms, and black olives on mine. The mushrooms looked and tasted like canned mushrooms. They were rubbery and not very flavorful. Fresh mushrooms would have been so much better. The chicken tasted like processed chicken strips. I was disappointed, and will try somewhere else next time.

48rVKpbIYjqxmDn7xT6k_g.text: My friends and I were searching for a simple, hole in the wall kinda pizza place. Fazio's was perfect! The staff was super nice and the food was good.   It was hard to choose from all the fantastic sounding starters but we finally decided on fried zucchini and it was great. We ordered a white pizza with a bunch of toppings which was delicious. The crust was seriously some of the best I've ever had. Plus they have Coke (boo Pepsi) and free refills.   My friends and I could not have been more pleased with our experience here!

-WEG9vwM8WeeDlCnRr_n-A.text: We had Fazio's deliver dinner last week & I can say, that it is as good as any pizza I've eaten from the South Hills.  (If you know who I mean).  I ordered a large white pizza w/ mushrooms & extra cheese and a Italian hoagie.  Both were fresh & delish!  The extra cheese was not necessary.  There was enough leftover for dinner the following Monday.        The delivery person was very friendly & helpful.  This is my new go to pizza place and I live in an area that have plenty choices.

e-ZjiEqwU8UFs9MRohHEPg.text: Love this place. Easily one of the best places in Pittsburgh. The only reason why I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 is that I usually order ranch and that's never in the order when I get it.

qm5HrkDMiKVzqzgtrTgLjg.text: Amazing everything! Great owner! Hidden gem of Pittsburgh! We tried literally everything and it was ALL incredible and scrumptious

CuKdO59DEHoVJx02TTUMig.text: I had purchased bagels and donuts for my new daylight "colleagues," but I didn't want to omit my former evening shift comrades, so 3 large pizzas acted as my going-away gift to them. A half an hour later, I inquired about the pies. "Hey Darren, man, thanks for the pizza. That shit was good." "You're welcome. Is there any left?" "Uhhhh. I dunno. Lemme get back to you, ok?" And with that, my co-worker split like James Brown at the Apollo. I jogged to the dumpster outside the dock. 3 empty pizza boxes were laying inside. 30 cuts of pizza were obliterated within 30 minutes. In the hot summer sun, I got...chills for my co-workers are indeed... youtube.com/watch?v=HjRX...

ELSFo04Bj4IjxQtaulXVkg.text: 10/10 for the friendliness and welcoming-ness of this place. Awesome bald guy who worked the register offered me a cup of water while waiting and we talked about the olympics for several minutes while i waited for my pizza. Pizza itself was delicious - and im from Long Island / hard to please. Was really greasy and that is a drawback for me but a little napkin dabbing did the trick! Wish i could order from them again but they dont deliver to my area!

x4RnX1y3SodYHPOq5kqaMA.text: Never had an issue with delivery time, though I tend to order on the early side, 6pm. Pizza is good but very salty.

6KajDyMKHr_dYU639Mog_g.text: I just wanted to add that the delivery experience is just as awesome as the take out/self pick up experience.  He said 30-40 minutes and it arrived on time, hot and scrumptious.  Love this place!  Keep up the great work!!

6e6pX8lhJArQ7JxUjdbJxg.text: The pizza here is AMAZING. I ordered only one slice and they made it completely fresh. Can't wait to devour an entire pie next time!

TpP0IHrwE91VBykf0-Po1g.text: Once again talk is cheap.  Ordered a pizza at 8:30 was told 40min to deliver didn't get till 9:55. Oh I live 3 min walking distance. My fault for being lazy I guess.  On top of that pizza was burn on edge and like warm so dough has that soft not done taste. Total let down. Hate to say it but Dominos woulda been better. Haha that not True dominos sucks too.  Cereal for dinner... Perfect.

Ma8B_s0gRCRCfc9Wv2k_IQ.text: Hawaiian pizza tasted like cardboard. Definitely do not recommend. 2 stars because delivery was fast and girl on the phone was very pleasant.

jh49EEFcVUXexDSAgreEqg.text: I ordered a pizza on 8/13 a  Saturday evening  it was  a very hot day so why cook  I'll get a pizza  It was around 8 25 pm the pizza arrived at 9:10pm let me just say the $18.00 I paid was a waste of my hard earned money .the pizza was cold the cheese looked like a pizza that sat out all night on your kitchen table.I called the shop for 2 days and got no answer.they lost my business and  I was a steady customer  alice

QpF6z8KUga0RKtWoJs6Q-w.text: Fazio's is my fave takeout pizza joint in the burgh. Their white pizza is sooo good and that crust. We usually order a white pizza and salad for delivery and sadly the delivery man now recognizes me. NOT what you want happening. Really, that's all I have gotten from Fazio's becacause it is so good I never want to order anything else! Delivery is fast, service is friendly, food is cheap/yummy! What more could you want?

FID-wd8xJmyPZkXK4jmOtw.text: Pizza is great, but a little on the salty side. However, it is one of the slower delivery services we use for Shadyside.  Delivery was recently 20 minutes late on a day in the middle of the week and the guy on the phone was quite rude about it. Apparently, only "John" is capable of helping to resolve issues; you'd have to call back when he is working.

uGhK7zPfXBMvJVdhs1hT9A.text: A solid neighborhood pizza joint. Decent pizza, hoagies are really good too. Pretty quick delivery and the employees are always nice. We try new places and always come back to Fazio's.

7Tlp4QnNMpz-SMWdwpSY5g.text: Ordered the provolone hoagie and bacon cheese fries. They were piping hot when they came and were delicious. Fazio's has some awesome Italian dressing for their subs. I ordered my food for delivery and it was there in 30 minutes as most places can take over an hour sometimes. I have lived in this area for 3 years and regret not trying Fazio's sooner! I will definitely be a repeat customer.

z80x97U5e7JzfWzFUOI7ZA.text: I really like their white pizza. In case you are like I was when I moved to Pittsburgh from CA (I had no idea what a white pizza was) it has: olive oil, ricotta, garlic, cheese and tomato. It is delicious with sausage or pepperoni on top. I was sad their prices went up a  little bit recently but they are still worth it.

eMEMqb13sxXwGcXxkLsmnw.text: I'm so disappointed. My husband and I just moved to this side of town and felt like some pizza. Since now Fiori's is so far away we have to find a new favorite over here..  So maybe we should have ordered the pizza? Maybe that's the only good thing here which gives this place its misleading 4 stars? We got a cheese calzone and wings.  The calzone was completely flat.. the dough was so thin it was translucent, when I poked it I could see a bubble of liquid moving underneath the top dough.. okay so this liquid is the most baffling thing I've ever seen in my food. We cut the calzone into 4 slices and like this liquid, not fat/grease but it was like literal water, the whole inside filling was soaked and overflowing with this water liquid.. the calzone was plain cheese (didn't order mushrooms since they use canned, so nothing in there should cause water..) uhh. Also there was a slight pink tint to the ricotta cheese and basically the entire gloopy liquidy glop of filling, it was all tinted pink. But we got no sauce, sauce on the side. And none of the fillings have ever dyed my food pink so this was just so weird and gross.. so many things wrong I can't even.  I thought maybe I can at least the wings. Husband goes "these are like walmart wings" and yes they sure are. There is a laughable amount of meat on the bones. The wings seem to be battered and fried, a LONG time ago, and by the time they arrived they were 100% soggy all the way through. This thick soggy layer of some kind of cardboardy bleh.  Like what is this place doing.. I wish more than anything that we had used a card to order but unfortunately we paid cash, and we feel literally robbed of the $30 we paid for this garbage..  Like I can't understand how a business exists and is still open and has 4 stars when their food is so absolutely awful?? I feel so misled by yelp, this is pretty rare.  Save your money! Swear I've had a lot of pizza and calzones from a lot of places, this is nottttttt what it should be. Really wish I could have my $30 back.

Qv-0YbaDJ8gF_UuB64hX5g.text: Best pizza in Pittsburgh! We're from California trying to find the best pizza and it was great!!! John, the owner, made the experience wonderful! Thanks for the shirts...we'll wear them with pride!!!

9DrbgTrx_wuxImzHrSREXQ.text: I love their pizza! I'm here once a week at least. I drove all the way from out by the airport to pickup delivery once. When i showed up, they acted like they had no idea what I was talking about. They even told me to check my phone as if I could have called another location, which there is only one, so not sure why they suggested that.   Not only did I know for a fact that I ordered from the right number bc I order once a week, but I know for a fact that the man telling me I never ordered was actually the one who took my order! Come on, guys. You think I don't recognize your voices by now? I only come in once a week. Needless to say, being a little miffed over the situation, I haven't returned, but boy is their pizza good.

ltqR7N0sixGvw3FSE4PshQ.text: A) Great staff! Everyone is super friendly! B) Buffalo chicken pizza is outstanding. I was skeptical at first with the French fries on it, but it was amazing.

ezCpZXrLoiws0YKJJiue-A.text: My favorite pizza! These guys know how to make a good pie. I'm moving soon and I'm sad to be leaving this place behind. Customer service - EXCELLENT, the food - AMAZING and DELICIOUS. They hustle to serve as many as possible in a day and they do it well. It's hard to find great service and food like this! Love the thin crust, the ingredients are always so fresh, and the time quoted is always accurate. If you haven't tried them, you need to...and if you have, visit them again!!

hqmDmPSL-eMuHExNNMjhfA.text: The pie crust was nice and thin. The onions cut just perfectly and the sausage crumbled well. The hot Italian sausage hoagie was delicious !

VZpYK4x77ejv3jls1XViZQ.text: To preface this: I rarely will make a Yelp review, but I had to make an exception for Fazio's. This is without a doubt my favorite pizza in the Bloomfield / Lawrenceville area. Perfect NY style slices with the perfect amount of cheese and sauce. Crust is top notch. We usually just get plain so not too sure about the toppings, but regular cheese is divine.

MRiEabuH96wcbTyTh35jUA.text: Always on the search for great spots that will deliver to Polish Hill. Fazio's Pizza stood out to me because their prices were a little lower than other places I've tried. I was able to get a large pizza with mushrooms and a dozen wings for about $20 and I was satisfied. The wings were VERY saucy, and the hot sauce was just hot enough for me to handle, nothing crazy.   I'll definitely give them another go and look forward to trying some new menu items.

ob81h3ycTkTqgTdoViMiEw.text: AWESOME! AWESOME! AWESOME! Fazio's is the best! We drive over 45 minutes at least once a week to eat here! Strombolis bigger than your head and we are always treated like family! The owner is there all day every day and goes in early to make the sauce and crust from SCRATCH. He is the only one who makes it, so it is consistent. He doesn't skimp on the quality of his ingredients, either. We will forever recommend Fazio's to anyone in the Pittsburgh area!

cO6m356ndKllqK67F-p4tw.text: I love the food and always have. I would like to give a five star rating but unfortunately i can't. I ordered a pizza and hogie at half time durning the Steelers game. It took almost two hours to be delivered. I don't live that far away. I get it that they want to watch the game . I have worked and still do have to work during Steelers games. But the customer comes first ! If that is not the case for them then they should not offer delivery service durning games. We were greatly disappointed. It was cold as well when delivered. I did call and was told it was out for delivery. Even after that it took another 30 minutes.

n3IDzXGpRSrdjSeLlph6Tg.text: Ever since we moved to Lawrenceville and tried this shop, it is our default choice for pizza (even though other shops are closer)! Nothing in the area beats Fazios!

fYjmZZYhEFJ9rAqXEAD9RA.text: The pizza is good, unless you want fresh toppings. Fazio's prides themselves and advertises the best and freshest ingredients, but they use CANNED mushrooms as a pizza topping (disgusting, slimy, and NOT worth what they charge). Be sure to avoid this very popular pizza topping when ordering from Fazio's unless you want a slimy, chemical flavored pizza. NOPE.

QuCHIYiEphOpuHrfOtwKsQ.text: What is up with these highly rated bloomfield pizza joints?  I ordered an XL regular (not white, not sicilian) pizza with pepperoni and green peppers.  Delivery was fine, but the pizza was terrible!!  The green peppers had a super off-taste that permeated the whole pizza.  Everyone agreed that it was very sub-par.  Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing off the menu, but after that experience I don't think I'm willing to give it a second shot.

1ndYhoh0NMeI0azmVemyHg.text: Top 3 pizza in Pittsburgh, the crust and cheese are excellent

Dh6ovwS-0wj9dRsHM58gWQ.text: Was in area and decided to stop in to try their pizza. I ordered the lunch special(2 slices and a drink for $5) . Still trying to finding really good pizza in Pittsburgh. Overall the pizza wasn't bad. None of the ingredients stood out. Good basic pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Fazio's Pizza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pepperoni and itilaian sausage.

3bnkt1Bov5BGNS2c51UL-g.text: The pizza and hoagies here are absolutely amazing. I do, however, recommend picking it up as delivery can sometimes take a bit long. Understandably so, the food is great!

5on5CBZjuhZDAW-i1BuSrQ.text: We had the BEST pizza today from Fazio's!! They were very polite on the phone as usual and it was delivered to us in Lawrenceville on time. And it was hot when we received it! It was cooked perfectly, just golden brown without any burn spots in the crust. It also had the perfect amount of cheese and sauce. (We don't like a lot of sauce on our pizza). 5 stars for sure!!!

yso6OVPHYIFQsFaeFxTsjQ.text: We've tried pizza shop after pizza shop after pizza shop (yes, sadly, we actually that much pizza) since moving into the area and our quest for that one place that's worth a second taste may have finally come to an end!  I can't speak for delivery quality, but each time I've gone in to for my pick-up order, I was greeted by the incredibly friendly guy - the owner, I presume - at the counter. I love shops with that neighborhoody feel. He knew everyone who came in to pick their orders up, and is really easy to chat with. If I was rating Fazio's on customer service it would be 5 easily, but the food is delicious, too!  We've only had their cheese pizza and chicken parm hoagie, but both were excellent. The pizza crust is really thin, and they definitely don't skimp on the cheese. As other reviewers stated, if you want a traditional, greasy pie, this is one of the best places to sate your craving in Pittsburgh. Despite the thin crust, it's never been undercooked and soggy, and we haven't had to deal with a burnt crust, either. As for the hoagie...their rolls are delicious and really help make the sandwich. I can't wait to try some of their other hoagies, but for now, the chicken parm might be hard to pass up for me.  Overall, Fazio's is the complete package for a pizza shop. Great customer service, a neighborhood vibe, and delicious, reasonably-priced food. You really can't' go wrong! Enjoy!

hnUBYM0sXxYQHW3Ek7jcUA.text: Fazio's is the BEST pizza delivery there is. Period. When my husband and I moved out of Bloomfield, our only sadness was that we would no longer be able to order from Fazio's.   Fazio's is truly the best Pizzaria we have come across, and that is saying a lot as my husband's father is from Italy... So we know a good pizza when we see one!   The pizza at Fazio's is greasy and salty, just the way we like it. The crust is thin, and the sauce is NOT sweet.   Pizza perfection.

Q4_M6NYbZU2LROahbIVNIQ.text: Soooooo good. Crispy thin crust and quick delivery for an independent place. Haven't had anything other than pizza but that's because it's sooooo good. Black and gold pizza is a must.

SSsrCJ1KdwN2LIh8OhK8SQ.text: FREAKING DELICIOUS.  PERFECT.  BEYOND SAVORY.  I've had pizza that runs the gamut, at enough locales around the country, and unfortunately, Pittsburgh is usually waaaaay off with good pizza recommendations.  Someone from OH actually steered me towards this place for real-deal NY-style pie.  The people are friendly, and the pizza...ohhhhh yes, the pizza.  I ordered three slices w/ spinach, and quickly fell?/levitated to Heaven.  The crust is chewy and crispy, sauce is savory with just enough sweetness, cheese has to be at least (I'm guessing) Grande brand or better (Italian), and the spinach was the "icing on the cake".  Unlike Benny Fiero's, which is the runner-up, in my opinion, Fazio's spinach was not only flavorful, but had that almost raw and great organic bitterness that can only come from a fresh variety, akin to broccoli rabe.  Nothing more to say, other than that if you have a pizza craving (or search for the ultimate NYC pie not in NYC), GO HERE NOW.  That is all.

photos.caption: Photo of Fazio's Pizza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Only spinach...yeah, buddy.

T9QxKlekDN8U2hFAYGZCxw.text: I called on a Wednesday evening around 5'Oclock! They repeatedly forwarded my calls to voicemail after ringing several times which means they were doing it on purpose. That's unprofessional!!! Not his you run an establishment no matter how busy you might be! No excuse to turn away customers! EVER!!!!

yy5c7Eq0Rg6q-kgJhESaYA.text: Last night gave Fazio's a try. Despite a heavy snow storm, a fresh medium cheese pizza was delivered in under 30 minutes. It was not as hot as it could have been, but it's understandable with outdoor sub freezing temperatures. The pizza crust is thinner but has a great texture. The cheese was just the right amount and doesn't overwhelm the sauce. Overall a strong basic pizza for your late night dining. I'll definitely be ordering again.

photos.caption: Photo of Fazio's Pizza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Regular cheese medium pizza $9.60

IM6RLLsWPVNagTaMr8heDQ.text: Good neighborhood joint, close to my house. Moved here from NYC so I do miss a good slice but this place works.  I find that a large pie or a slice cut from a large pie is best and most like a thin NY slice. The smaller you go, the thicker the crust is which is fine if you're into that.  I give five stars because the people here are always super friendly and pleasant. From the girl at the front counter to the owner to the delivery guys to the guys in the back making the pies. They seem to care about their customer experience and that keeps me coming back. Also, there are a couple tables outside which I enjoy when the weather is nice.

nsWekQYE0c5WG0WYct1rCA.text: This is a neighborhood pizza shop. Family owned for a longtime. They have good pizza and wege. Friendly stuff. It is my always go to for a fast pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Fazio's Pizza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

SfLc02GLZS-x2HlmaY_8iw.text: I've had a lot of pizzas since moving to Pittsburgh from CA , and this place has won me over . Their pizza isn't loaded with dough , which makes it a lot more enjoyable  .   I must've ate 4 slices lol . I knew it was going to be my favorite pizza place once I smelled my pizza on its way out to the table, I kid you not .   Owner and staff are super sweet and friendly . If you're going to spend money on a good pizza , come here to avoid being disappointed lol .

XN3wksNaEENZHf_RwyAZUA.text: Good pizza but horrible service. I have been a loyal and consist customer for about 4 years and have maybe had a handful of decent interactions with the people who work there, nothing overly friendly, (which is to be expected from a local Pittsburgh pizza spot) but usually nothing too bad. To be honest this was my favorite pizza spot in the city but I can't go back anymore. Fazios has a deal, $.90 more than a medium and you can get a large. It sounds great but from my own experience I have found THE PIZZA GETS REALLY FLIMSY AND GREASY IF YOU GET A LARGE. Seriously, almost to the point of being inedible (don't even think about storing it overnight). Thankfully, the medium is bomb (like I said, it was my favorite pizza).   So I make my order of 2 mediums. I go to pick it up. And instead of paying leaving and being thanked for giving them my money, the cashier decides to explain their $.90 deal. I really didn't feel like explaining myself (cause the customer is always right?, Especially AFTER they paid?) and again instead of thanking me for giving him my money and letting me leave to eat, he decides to tell me why it's a bad idea to order 2 mediums. He even tells me how it can save me and my family money. I tell him 'if I buy 2 mediums I'll be back faster lol' to which he replied 'dude we sell 1000 pizzas a week do you think 2 pizzas matter?'.To me, this seems like they don't need my business. Which unfortunately is going to happen

rkjN_Pk2JlXY69IY3rzXZg.text: I like the thin crust pizza these guys serve up. Flavor of the sauce is good. Never any problems with orders here. Food is always cooked properly and ready on time.  Pizza lovers check this place out if you haven't before. They've been around forever and it's easy to see why.

l0Pk_PJiiJTT6tfiW4QWKA.text: I was pleasantly suprised to find a reasonably priced pizza and qing delivery to my work place. However when my (lack luster) food arrived I was quickly reminded that you get what you pay for! Delivery and customer service was not bad, but the terrible cardboard re-reheated slice of pepperoni and the buffalo wings with the barely there buffalo sauce MORE than qualify this establishment for the two star rating and a never again! Also the menu with no descriptions leaves a lot to be desired...most customers would like to know if you have breaded, seasoned, or boneless wings etc..

FKg2N3g5qr5Am1zSSmL0bg.text: Very good doesn't do this awesome pizza joint justice.  Youll have to make up new words when you bite into their delicious crispy crust yet the top is light as air. Topping qre high quality. Please do your self a favor and try the meatballs. They are top notch made fresh daily.

xODCCGMwHrrOAh5RKrKQAw.text: I love it here. I know that sometimes people think that the staff is rude but I really think that they are just no nonsense. The food is good and they are fast. I always think that when I go in the are nice and cheerful. But I do work and live pretty close and I will say that I have came here more often than maybe I should admit. They even have an outside patio that is nice in the summer to go out and eat in the shade. They have a few tables out there so you can bring some friends and have a good time. Family owned, local. You really just need to try this place out.   My favorite is just their lunch specials. You go in and get two slices and a drink. Yum. My favorite topping is the banana peppers. Yummy. But then again anything on a cheesy crust is good in my book. The crust here is so good. It is crispy and thin and it makes me very very happy.   My other favorite lunch special is the 1/2 sub and fries combo. I like the Italian sub with extra tomatoes and onions. Fazio's has some awesome Italian dressing that they whip up and I always ask for more on the side to dip. Wait...I also like their wing special. Seriously, maybe I like to eat everything on the menu! The wings are super crispy and really good. They have a lot of meat on them so you will not be disappointed.   This is another awesome neighborhood pizza shop. Really just try this place out. I promise that the staff is not scary as some other people wrote about. Come and enjoy a lunch special or just order a full pie. You will not regret it!

G96xdBLViMR96ALVjSM0Pw.text: Wonderful pizza and nice staff. Pizza is crispy and delicious. Wings are Alonso really good and covered in sauce.

XNJTUu-Ou_-JneiXwF5bEg.text: Conveniently located only a couple blocks from children's hospital. The pizza is very good. One of the better crusts I had on the Sicilian cut. Definitely would recommend. Placed the order at the pizza joint and had it within 10 minutes.

g59A9mFDTeiQro3xihKQqA.text: BEST pizza in Pittsburgh!  My husband and I have been rather depressed - we moved out of Bloomfield and can no longer have our weekly Fazios pizza night!! Now and again, we will drive by and grab a slice to hold us over until the next time we can feast on the cheesy, greasy goodness!  If you like thin crust, lots of cheese, and a non-sweet sauce, this Fazio's is for you. Also, their Italian Calzone is AMAZING.   They are a small family owned shop and do no sort of social media, marketing, or advertising... all their efforts go into their amazing, amazing pizza.  Ten times better than Fiori's, Aiello's, Mineo's, Genoa's, Graziano's, you name it - Fazio's will beat it.

ujY7fbgwX1_QzRDxPZlReQ.text: Friendly, quick and delicious! Pizza was crispy and was cooked perfectly. It had a nice balance of sauce to cheese.

uAbTlMR8pXU9lvrTf5xi5Q.text: This place is awesome! We took our troop there for lunch. Our group devoured the 3 xl pizzas in no time. We called ahead to let them know we were coming to make sure they could fit 10 girls and 4 adults. They had everything already for us...even called to make sure everything was ok as we ran a bit late with traffic. The pizza was delicious and the staff is amazing. Owner even let us taste homemade meatballs..they are super good!! The wonderful woman working there even gave each of the girls a lollipop! My daughter said "this is my new favorite place" Thanks for a great lunch we will be back!!

g2rijV0u3Z4tM2G_euCHMw.text: Great family owned pizzeria two blocks from Children's Hospital. They will deliver for free or it is a nice walk if you need some air and time outside. We ordered small cheese pizza, half meatball hoagie and garden salad. Pizza was good and the meatballs...WOW! You can tell they're homemade not frozen. Will be ordering from here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Fazio's Pizza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. more wings, think medium
Photo of Fazio's Pizza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. wings
Photo of Fazio's Pizza - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. bbq wings

xGBzFkcVJP81JhdQe6yX-Q.text: I ordered a white pizza and garlic wings from Fazio's. When I called to place my order, the man who answered was prompt and kind. When I picked up my order twenty minutes later, he remembered my name and had my hot food waiting for me! I recommend the food here and I'm a large fan of the courteous service.

X28pH3S6R_jPWjU2Z3k9_w.text: I don't know how to put Fazio's into words. It can only be sung. All I have to say about Fazio's has already been sung. Stop reading this immediately and go listen to the eternal words of Smokey Robinson and his wonderful composition, "You've Really Got a Hold on Me" if you want to know more about why you should eat every meal at Fazio's forever. Except Mondays because they are closed.

-Cj1itWu_zDBuR9IYh7aSw.text: Best pizza I have ever had.  Crust is crispy. Vegetables are cooked but still crunchy. Only in town for 4 days, but definitely coming back before we leave.
